subject: p14147787
Findings: The cardiomediastinal and hilar silhouettes remain stable. There are bilateral upper lung reticular and nodular opacities with associated volume loss, stable compared to the prior study. The lungs are otherwise clear with no focal consolidation. There is no pleural effusion, pulmonary edema, or pneumothorax. The osseous structures are unremarkable.
Impression: No focal consolidation to suggest pneumonia. Stable bilateral upper lung zone fibrosis consistent with history of sarcoidosis.
